docs.title: cluster
docs.text: Sequence clustering wrapper around external 'vclust' with three preconfigured modes for common viral genomics workflows.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The cluster command provides a simplified interface to the powerful vclust tool, implementing the most common use cases from the vclust wiki with sensible defaults while allowing advanced customization.

docs.title: Modes
docs.text: Mode Description Algorithm Metric Use Case dereplication Remove redundant sequences, keep representatives cd-hit ani Reduce dataset to representative genomes (Section 6.3) votu Cluster into viral Operational Taxonomic Units leiden ani Group contigs following MIUViG standards (Section 6.2) species Classify viruses into species complete tani Species classification following ICTV standards (Section 6.1)

docs.title: Default Parameters by Mode
docs.text: Parameter dereplication votu species Algorithm cd-hit leiden complete Metric ani ani tani ANI cutoff 95% 95% 95% Query coverage 85% 85% None Pre-filter min-ident 95% 95% 70% Output file clusters.tsv clusters.tsv species.tsv Representatives file dereplicated_representatives.fna representatives.fna representatives.fna

docs.title: Command Options
docs.text: Option Type Default Description --mode Choice Required dereplication | votu | species --input-contigs Path Required Input FASTA file with viral sequences --output-folder Path clustered-contigs Output directory for results --threads Integer 0 Number of threads (0 = all cores) --vclust-params String None Custom vclust parameters (see Advanced Usage)

docs.title: Basic Examples
docs.text:
# Dereplicate viral contigs
phu cluster --mode dereplication --input-contigs viral_contigs.fna

# Cluster into vOTUs following MIUViG standards
phu cluster --mode votu --input-contigs viral_contigs.fna

# Classify viruses into species following ICTV standards
phu cluster --mode species --input-contigs complete_genomes.fna

docs.title: Advanced Usage with Custom Parameters
docs.text: The --vclust-params option allows you to customize any vclust parameter while maintaining the convenience of predefined modes. Parameters are automatically routed to the appropriate vclust command (prefilter, align, cluster).

docs.title: Large Dataset Optimization (Wiki Section 6.6)
docs.text:
# Process large diverse dataset (IMG/VR style)
phu cluster --mode votu --input-contigs large_dataset.fna \
  --vclust-params="--min-kmers 4 --batch-size 2000000 --kmers-fraction 0.2 --outfmt lite"

docs.title: Highly Redundant Dataset (Wiki Section 6.7)
docs.text:
# Process highly redundant sequences
phu cluster --mode votu --input-contigs redundant_genomes.fna \
  --vclust-params="--min-kmers 10 --batch-size 100000 --max-seqs 1000 --outfmt lite --ani 0.97 --qcov 0.95"

docs.title: Custom Thresholds
docs.text:
# More stringent clustering
phu cluster --mode votu --input-contigs genomes.fna \
  --vclust-params="--ani 0.98 --qcov 0.90"

# Species clustering with custom genus threshold
phu cluster --mode species --input-contigs genomes.fna \
  --vclust-params="--tani 0.97"
